item.description:
Hi Everyone...

How about making our typical Sunday Brunch into an early dinner to celebrate the New Year? Since the Franklin Café does not do brunch, on January 11th we could meet at 5:00pm at:

Franklin Café (The South End)
278 Shawmut Ave.
Boston, MA 02118
617 350 0010
Price: Reasonable
www.franklincafe.com (check them out on the web)

The Franklin Café comes with rave... reviews! I've been wanting to try this venue for a while now. Let me know what you think. And, if people really have their heart set on brunch, we can pick another spot. With all of that said though, here's a little history on the Franklin Café...

In 1995 David Dubois was approached by Maureen McLaughlin, one of Boston’s most well known bartenders, with the idea of opening a South End neighborhood restaurant/bar that would reflect Boston’s growing cosmopolitan sense of self.

After sixteen months of development and build-out David and Maureen opened the Franklin Café in December of 1996. The restaurants unique ability to combine some of the cities best Modern American cuisine, a great wine list, nine microbrews on tap, with a lively eclectic bar scene made it an instant favorite. This coupled with a full menu served seven days a week until 1:30 a.m. Made late night at the Franklin Café the place to unwind for the staff from many of Boston’s best restaurants.

All these years later the Franklin Café has become synonymous with consistent quality, value, and a great time as well as bringing these two area-natives local, national, and international accolade and attention. Most importantly to David and Maureen these two restaurants have become a healthy and productive part of the fabric of their respective communities.

Anyway, hope to see you all at the Franklin Café in early 2009. If not, whatever you're up to, I hope you are doing well and taking care.

Cheers,
Michael
